Package org.logevents.observers.file

Class FilenameFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logevents.observers.file.FilenameFormatter
  • public class FilenameFormatter
extends Object
    Creates, parses and scans for file names matching a specified pattern, such as logs/%mdc{tenant:-common}/%date{YYYY-'w'WW}/%application-%EE.log, which would expand to logs/example.org/2020-W01/myapplication-Mon.log if the MDC variable "tenant" was "example.org" and the date 2019/12/30 (which was the first week of the year 2020).

    The following conversion words are supported in the filename:

    • %date: The date and time of the log event. Optionally supports a date formatting pattern from DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern(java.lang.String) e.g. %date{DD-MMM HH:mm:ss}. Default format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS.
    • %marker[{defaultValue}]: Marker (if any)
    • %mdc{key:-default}: the specified MDC variable or default value if not set
    • %application: The value of Configuration.getApplicationName()
    • %node: The value of Configuration.getNodeName() ()}
